intro: Hieracium oligograptum, commonly known as the slender hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in meadows, grasslands, and disturbed soils, preferring sunny to partially shaded conditions. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its flowers consist of a yellow disk surrounded by white to pale yellow ray florets. Hieracium oligograptum is often found in open habitats and can sometimes form dense colonies.
